12511.content:
Few can believe the news. After an epic battle against Karate legend Heihachi Mishima, Christie Monteiro has emerged the winner of this year's King of the Iron Fist Tournament. Still only 19 years old, Christie has proven herself to be a true Capoeira prodigy, having achieved this level of martial arts prowess after only 2 years of training. Now the head of the Mishima Empire, she has the financial means to conduct a global search for Eddy Gordo, her missing tutor. She affords herself a mere day's rest before she takes a tour of Mishima's Headquarters.

As Christie begins, she is unsure as to what her duties as a corporate executive will entail. She listens half-heartedly to her assistant, a petite Filipina named Annette De La Paz, as she describes the intricacies of the Mishima Finance Offices. They walk briskly through a number of meetings, during which Annette introduces her new boss to a number of zaibatsu employees. Christie has already forgotten their names by the time they reach the elevator.

"Listen, Annette," Christie pleads, "I'm so glad you're helping me with all this. It's just that I can barely concentrate on all this while Eddy is still missing. When can we begin searching for him?"

Annette gives her a reassuring nod. She waits until Christie finishes before pressing the button for the 10th floor.

"Ms. Monteiro, I understa-"

"Christie, please."

"Christie, I understand what you mean. Please know that we will be conducting a search for Mr. Gordo just as soon as..."

Christie diverts her attention towards the elevator panel. In the bottom-left corner is a small red button, encased in safety glass. Beside it is a keycard slot. Annette is still talking when Christie looks back up at her.

"Annette," she says, raising her hand in a silencing gesture. "What floor does that button lead to?"

"That, Ms. Monteiro, leads to Mishima's most advanced R & D Facility. All of the work done there has until now been supervised directly by Mr. Mishima himself. Of course, nothing in there is of any relevance to-"

"Really? What sort of research Heihachi been doing? And please, it's Christie."

"Well, Christie, I can't honestly say. Even I was restricted access from the facility."

"You really don't know what's down there?" Christie asks, surprised.

Annette nods, seeming slightly embarrassed. "I guess Heihachi didn't consider me trustworthy enough."

Christie feels the curiosity overwhelming her. What secrets could possibly be lurking below them? Grinning, she tugs at the keycard that had until now been tucked inside her blouse. She watches as the card slot's LED blinks green as she forces in her ID; almost immediately after the elevator starts to descend. Christie waits for the fluttering sensation in her belly to subside before she speaks again.

"I guess today's your lucky day then, Annette. You can reschedule my meeting with the board for later this afternoon."

For what seems the first time since Christie was introduced to her, Annette smiles. "Will do. Still, I can't believe that Heihachi didn't seal off the facility before giving you Mishima Corp."

"Oh, I'm not so surprised. After all, It would have taken him some time to completely block off the facility. He would only have done so if he'd thought there was a chance he would lose." Christie smirks. "Somehow I don't think humility is one of Heihachi's strong points."

The elevator bobs lightly upon reaching the basement floor, forcing Annette and Christie to grasp the brass railing beside them. There is a familiar chime as the lift doors open. Both Annette and Christie squint as they exit the lift, its fluorescent bulbs having left them ill-prepared for the relative darkness of Mishima R & D. Bored of those concepts already? Well then, feel free to create your very own original character! There's very few rules to this interactive short of preserving coherency really, and they are as follows:

1) Pick first-person (I), second-person (you), OR third-person (she) viewpoints! However, please preserve that choice throughout. For instance, if one chapter is: "She tilted her head back, and (X) slid down, down into that fleshy abyss, when..." then the next chapter should not be something like "I fell for what seemed like eons before I reached that hellish zone, that place would surely be my tomb." 3) Please, PLEASE, no extremely short chapters, and certainly no short endings. It is allowed to end the story in a given branch, however remember the golden rule of any story: The ending is usually the climax, and the anticlimax rolled into one. In other words, make sure something story-ending happens and that all loose ends are wrapped up suitably. If you end it with a small paragraph, you better believe that chapter's getting deleted.


Now yes, I know it sucks when somebody goes modhappy on your story. So I will not, EXCEPT in the case where these rules are deliberately flouted or in other extenuating circumstances. Suffice to say, your story is safe unless it's blatantly racist or offensive (in other ways than pornography). By that I mean, you won't get a chapter deleted for saying a character is black, NOR if you use, say, the word "nigger" as being said by another character when it is part of that character. You probably WILL have a chapter deleted if you use the word multiple times in narration unrelated to a character's thoughts, etc.

This is getting long. Have fun with this, and don't worry about keeping it TOO clean =)
